greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of iterations of A007733 required to reach 1.
comment: In other words, the minimal height (not counting k) of the power tower 2^(2^(...^(2^k)...)) required to make it eventually constant modulo n (=A245970(n)) for sufficiently large k.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: a = Function[n, k = 0; m = n; While[m > 1, m = A007733[m]; k++]; k];
program: (PARI) a(n) = {if (n==1, return(0)); nb = 1; while((n = znorder(Mod(2, n/2^valuation(n, 2)))) != 1, nb++); nb;} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 11 2015
xref: Cf. A007733, A256607 (second iteration), A256758 (positions of records), A003434, A227944 (similarly built upon the totient function).
results.author: _Ivan Neretin_, Apr 09 2015
